skill.name: proxychains
skill.description: Auto-detect network issues and force proxy usage with proxychains4. Use this skill when encountering connection timeouts, DNS failures, or blocked network access. Default proxy is http://127.0.0.1:9910
skill.summary: Auto-detect network issues and force proxy usage with proxychains4. Use this skill when encountering...
skill.author: 2025Emma

security_audit.summary: Legitimate proxychains4 documentation skill. Static findings are false positives - the scanner flagged documentation examples (command syntax, proxy configurations) as security patterns. No executable malicious code, no data exfiltration, no credential theft. The setup script only creates config files and tests proxy connectivity.

content.user_title: Auto-detect network issues and use proxy
content.value_statement: Network connection failures block development work. This skill helps Claude automatically route network traffic through proxychains4 when timeouts, DNS failures, or blocked access occur. Configure once and let Claude handle proxy routing automatically.
actual_capabilities: Auto-detect network errors including timeouts, connection refused, and DNS failures
Automatically prepend proxychains4 to failed commands
Support git, pip, npm, curl, wget, and docker through proxy
Provide troubleshooting guidance when proxy issues occur
limitations: Requires proxychains4 installed on the system
Requires a running proxy service at configured address
Does not work with statically linked binaries
Only supports TCP connections, not UDP

use_cases.title: Access blocked resources
use_cases.description: Route git, pip, npm commands through proxy when accessing GitHub, PyPI, or npmjs.

use_cases.title: Configure proxy automation
use_cases.description: Automatically route docker pulls and system operations through corporate proxies.

use_cases.title: Enable network problem resolution
use_cases.description: Let AI assistants handle connectivity issues without manual proxy configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Basic proxy check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if network connectivity works. If there are connection failures, use proxychains4 to retry.

prompt_templates.title: Install through proxy
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the required packages using pip or npm. If network issues occur, use proxychains4 to retry.

prompt_templates.title: Clone repository
prompt_templates.prompt: Clone the repository from GitHub. If direct connection fails, use proxychains4 for git clone.

prompt_templates.title: Configure proxy
prompt_templates.prompt: Check proxychains4 installation and configure it for 127.0.0.1:9910. Test the connection.

output_examples.input: Clone the requests library repository from GitHub
output: Detected direct connection failure. Using proxychains4...

output_examples.input: Install the latest version of axios via npm
output: Direct npm connection timed out. Retrying with proxychains4...

best_practices: Install proxychains4 before using this skill (apt install proxychains4 or brew install proxychains-ng)
Ensure your proxy service is running at 127.0.0.1:9910 before network operations
Test proxy connectivity separately if commands continue to fail
anti_patterns: Using this skill without a running proxy service (will cause all commands to fail)
Assuming proxychains works with statically linked binaries
Forgetting that UDP-based connections are not supported by proxychains

faq.question: What operating systems are supported?
faq.answer: Linux, macOS, and WSL. Install proxychains4 separately using your package manager.

faq.question: What is the default proxy address?
faq.answer: The default proxy is http://127.0.0.1:9910. Configure your proxy software to listen on this port.

faq.question: Does this work with Docker?
faq.answer: Yes. Use proxychains4 docker pull image:tag to pull images through the proxy.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only routes existing traffic through your configured proxy. No data collection occurs.

faq.question: Why do commands still fail?
faq.answer: Common causes: proxy not running, wrong port, firewall blocking, or statically linked binary.

faq.question: How is this different from environment variables?
faq.answer: proxychains4 intercepts system calls at the library level, forcing all TCP connections through proxy.
